sen.j: 徳川将軍家（德川將軍家、とくがわしょうぐんけ）は、徳川宗家（德川宗家、とくがわそうけ、徳川氏の宗家）であり、江戸幕府の征夷大将軍家。
sen.e: Tokugawa Shogunate Family was the head family of Tokugawa and a family of Seii taishogun (literally, "the great general who subdues the barbarians") in the Edo bakufu.

Tokugawa Shogunate Family was the head family of Tokugawa (the head family of the Tokugawa clan) and a family of Seii taishogun (literally, "the great general who subdues the barbarians") in the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 原文の（）内の訳を補足しました。
sen.e: Tokugawa Shogunate Family was the head family of Tokugawa (the head family of the Tokugawa clan) and a family of Seii taishogun (literally, "the great general who subdues the barbarians") in the Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 江戸時代264年にわたって、日本の実質上の君主・支配者として武家社会を含む日本社会全体の頂点に君臨した。
sen.e: Over a period of 264 years during the Edo period, it topped the whole of the Japanese society, which include the samurai world, practically as the monarch and ruler of Japan.
Over a period of 264 years during the Edo period, it topped the whole of the Japanese society, which included the samurai world, practically as the monarch and ruler of Japan.
sen.cmt: 「武家社会を含む」の「含む」を三人称過去形としました。
sen.e: Over a period of 264 years during the Edo period, it topped the whole of the Japanese society, which included the samurai world, practically as the monarch and ruler of Japan.

sen.j: 多くの側室を大奥に抱えていたが、宗家はたびたび血筋がとだえ、近親の分家や徳川御三家、御三卿から養子を迎えることが少なくなかった。
sen.e: The Tokugawa head family had many concubines in its inner palace, but it often lost lineage and had to adopt children from Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) and Gosankyo (three other privileged branches) many times.

The Tokugawa head family had many concubines in its inner palace, but it often lost lineage and had to adopt children from Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) and Gosankyo (three other privileged branches) many times.

The Tokugawa head family had many concubines in its inner palace, but it often lost lineage and had to adopt children from Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) and Gosankyo (three other privileged branches) many times.

sen.j: 明治維新後、十五代当主徳川慶喜は謹慎を命ぜられ、徳川家達が養子に立てられた。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, the fifteenth family head Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA was placed under house arrest, and Iesato TOKUGAWA was adopted as a son.
After the Meiji Restoration, the fifteenth family head Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA was placed under house arrest, and Iesato TOKUGAWA was adopted as a son.
sen.cmt: 必要だと思われるところに冠詞”the”を補足しました。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the fifteenth family head Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA was placed under house arrest, and Iesato TOKUGAWA was adopted as a son.

sen.j: 家達は新政府により駿河国・遠江国・三河国に70万石を改めて与えられて駿府に移住し、駿府の町を静岡と改名して静岡藩を立てた。
sen.e: Iesato was officially given 700,000 goku (crop yields) in Suruga, Totomi and Mikawa Provinces by the new government, and he moved to Sunpu, which he renamed to Shizuoka, thus establishing Shizuoka Domain.

Iesato was officially given 700,000 koku (crop yields) in Suruga, Totomi and Mikawa Provinces by the new government, and he moved to Sunpu, which he renamed to Shizuoka, thus establishing Shizuoka Domain.
sen.cmt: 「70万石」の「石」を”koku”に変更しました。
sen.e: Iesato was officially given 700,000 koku (crop yields) in Suruga, Totomi and Mikawa Provinces by the new government, and he moved to Sunpu, which he renamed to Shizuoka, thus establishing Shizuoka Domain.

sen.j: 廃藩置県を経て東京に再移住、華族に列し、公爵を授けられて徳川公爵家となった。
sen.e: After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he moved to Tokyo again, where he joined the peerage, was conferred a title of prince and became a member of the Tokugawa Prince family.
sen.cmt: ※日本での「公爵」は「duke」ではなく、正式には「prince」とのことです。
sen.e: After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he moved to Tokyo again, where he joined the peerage, was conferred a title of prince and became a member of the Tokugawa Prince family.

After Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), he moved to Tokyo again, where he joined the peerage, was conferred a title of prince and became a member of the Tokugawa Prince family.

sen.j: 家達は長らく貴族院議長を務め、嫡子の十七代徳川家正は戦後、最後の貴族院議長を務めた。
sen.e: Iesato acted as president of Kizokuin (the House of Peers) for a long time, and in the postwar period, his legitimate son, Iemasa TOKUGAWA, who was the seventeenth family head, became its last president.
Iesato acted as a president of Kizokuin (the House of Peers) for a long time, and after the war, his legitimate son, Iemasa TOKUGAWA, who was the seventeenth family head, became its last president.
sen.cmt: ①必要だと思われるところに冠詞”a”を補足しました。 ②「戦後」の訳“in the postwar period”は「次の戦争が始まるまでの期間」という意味合いが強いと思われましたので、”after the war”に訳を変えました。
sen.e: Iesato acted as a president of Kizokuin (the House of Peers) for a long time, and after the war, his legitimate son, Iemasa TOKUGAWA, who was the seventeenth family head, became its last president.

sen.j: 2003年、十八代当主徳川恒孝は、宗家の貴重な遺産を管理するため、財団法人徳川記念財団を設立した。
sen.e: In 2003, the eighteenth family head Tsunenari TOKUGAWA established Tokugawa Memorial Foundation to manage the family's valuable heritage.
In 2003, the eighteenth family head Tsunenari TOKUGAWA established Tokugawa Memorial Foundation to manage the family's valuable heritage.
In 2003, the eighteenth family head Tsunenari TOKUGAWA established Tokugawa Memorial Foundation to manage the family's valuable heritage.
